TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TextPattern extends System.Windows.Automation.BasePattern

Docs.summary: Represents controls that contain text.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> class may not provide for text features that exist only in a particular UI Automation provider. For these unique and often advanced features, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> class provides methods for a UI Automation client to access the corresponding native object model.

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Animations appear on the screen only; the animated text prints, but the animation effect does not.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle>. The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.None>.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1000](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1000)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2000](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2000)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the () attribute of a text range down to the sub-language level; for example, Frenchâ€“Switzerland (fr-CH) instead of French (fr).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>. The default value is the language of the application [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
See <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] for more detail on the language code format.
> [!NOTE] > There might be cases where the server does not support the language tag or authors cannot use it. In those cases the default applies.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1005](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1005)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2005](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2005)]

Docs.summary: Gets a text range that encloses the main text of a document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some auxiliary text such as headers, footnotes, or annotations might not be included.
## Examples In the following code example, the targetTextPattern member variable is a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> object obtained from a text provider of interest.
[!code-csharp[FindText#DocumentRange](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#documentrange)] [!code-vb[FindText#DocumentRange](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#documentrange)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Example values for this attribute include "Arial Black" and "Arial Narrow".
The values for this attribute are non-localized.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.String>. The default value is an `empty string`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#FontName](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#fontname)] [!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#FontName](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#fontname)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute refers to the relative stroke, thickness, or boldness of a font.
This attribute is modeled after the `lfWeight` field in [GDI LOGFONT](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/fontext_1wmq.asp). For consistency, the following values have been adopted from LOGFONT: 0=DontCare, 100=Thin, 200=ExtraLight or UltraLight, 300=Light, 400=Normal or Regular, 500=Medium, 600=SemiBold or DemiBold, 700=Bold, 800=ExtraBold or UltraBold, and 900=Heavy or Black.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>. The default value is `zero`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1008](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1008)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2008](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2008)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the ([COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp)) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of this attribute is equivalent to the text or font color.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>. The default value is `zero`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1009](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1009)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2009](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2009)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange[] GetSelection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves a collection of disjoint text ranges associated with the current text selection or selections.
Docs.returns: A collection of disjoint text ranges.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If no text is selected, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.GetSelection%2A> returns the degenerate text range (empty range) at the position of the system cursor (text insertion point).
If the system cursor (text insertion point) is not present, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.GetSelection%2A> might return `null`.
> [!NOTE] > Use the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.SupportedTextSelection%2A> property to test if text selection or positioning of the text insertion point is supported by the control.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1046](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1046)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2046](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2046)]

Docs.exception: The text container does not support text selection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange[] GetVisibleRanges() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of disjoint text ranges from a text container where each text range begins with the first partially visible line through to the end of the last partially visible line.
Docs.returns: The collection of visible text ranges within the container or an empty array. is never returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Disjoint text ranges may occur when any content of a text container is obscured by an overlapping window or other object, or when a text container with a multi-column layout has one or more columns partially scrolled out of view.
If no text is visible, a degenerate (empty) text range is returned. This empty range can be returned if the text container is empty or when all text is scrolled out of view.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#VisibleRanges](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#visibleranges)] [!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#VisibleRanges](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#visibleranges)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute represents the horizontal text alignment applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment>. The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment.Left>
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1011](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1011)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2011](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2011)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute represents the first-line indentation in points (<xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>. The default value is `zero`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1012](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1012)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2012](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2012)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute represents the read-only state of the document associated with the calling text range.
> [!NOTE] > If a document or file is read-only, but you can still edit it and save it as another file, the text is not considered read-only.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>. The default value is `false`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.

Docs.summary: Identifies the () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>. The default value is `false`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1024](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1024)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2024](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2024)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute represents the bottom margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>. The default value is `zero`.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1025](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1025)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2025](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2025)]

remarks.format:

This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>. The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies whether the value of a given attribute varies over a text range in a rich edit control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A> returns `TextPattern.MixedAttributeValue` to indicate this variation instead of a collection of attribute values.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Object>.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1000](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1000)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2000](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2000)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the pattern.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
## Examples [!code-csharp[FindText#TextPatternPattern](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#textpatternpattern)] [!code-vb[FindText#TextPatternPattern](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#textpatternpattern)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange RangeFromChild(class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement childElement) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves a text range enclosing a child element such as an image, hyperlink, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xl](~/includes/tlasharptla-xl-md.md)] spreadsheet, or other embedded object.
Docs.returns: A range that spans the child element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If there is no text in the range where the child element exists, a degenerate (empty) range is returned.
The `childElement` parameter is either a child of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> or from the array of children of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange>.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#GetTextElement](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#gettextelement)] [!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#GetTextElement](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#gettextelement)] [!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#GetRangeFromChild](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#getrangefromchild)] [!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#GetRangeFromChild](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#getrangefromchild)]

Docs.exception: The element is not a child of the text container.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange RangeFromPoint(valuetype System.Windows.Point screenLocation) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the degenerate (empty) text range nearest to the specified screen coordinates.
Docs.returns: A degenerate range nearest the specified location. is never returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A text range that wraps a child object is returned if the screen coordinates are within the coordinates of an image, hyperlink, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xl](~/includes/tlasharptla-xl-md.md)] spreadsheet, or other embedded object.
Because hidden text is not ignored by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.RangeFromPoint%2A>, a degenerate range from the visible text closest to the given point is returned.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1049](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1049)] [!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#1049](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#1049)]

Docs.exception: A given point is outside the associated with the text pattern.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether a text provider supports selection and, if so, the type of selection supported.

remarks.format: ## Examples [!code-csharp[FindText#SupportedTextSelection](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#supportedtextselection)] [!code-vb[FindText#SupportedTextSelection](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#supportedtextselection)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute represents the collection of tab stops in points (<xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>).
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
UI Automation clients get the value of the attribute by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A>.
Values for this attribute are an array of type <xref:System.Double>. The default value is an `empty` array.
## Examples The following example shows how to obtain an attribute value for a range of text in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is used as the text provider for example purposes only. [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_notepad](~/includes/tlasharptla-notepad-md.md)] is not guaranteed to support the attribute value being requested.
[!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1040](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1040)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2040](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2040)]

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent TextSelectionChangedEvent

Docs.summary: Identifies the event raised when the text selection is modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some text controls handle the text insertion point (cursor) as a zero-width text selection and might raise `TextSelectionChangedEvent` when the cursor is moved.
> [!NOTE] > To follow cursor movements, UI Automation clients are advised to keep track of insertion point changes by listening for corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element events rather than depending on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.TextSelectionChangedEvent>.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPatternIdentifiers>.
## Examples [!code-csharp[FindText#SelectionChanged](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#selectionchanged)] [!code-vb[FindText#SelectionChanged](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FindText/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#selectionchanged)]
